page.title: 05HISTORY OF CARNFORTH STATION
page.content: Carnforth station was remodelled when the main lines were electrified. Prior to that the station had 6 platforms. Main line platforms for passengers travelling to London and Glasgow and platforms for Leeds and Barrow. The trains 30 years ago were hauled by steam locomotives. In those days more travelled by rail because it was cheaper. The railways were used to convey passengers from industrial towns to seaside resorts. Nearby Morecambe for instance used to accept about 40 special trains each weekend during the holidays. There were up to 100 trains daily passing through Carnforth. The station dealt with over 2000 vehicles daily:coal and coke from Yorkshire and Lancashire collieries, steel and iron from West Cumberland and cattle from the Irish boats sailing between Belfast and Heysham.
